Legal_Issue: Whether the Board properly applied s. 108(4) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act regarding compelling reasons
Procedural_Context: Judicial review under s. 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evaluation_Standard: Compelling reasons due to past persecution
Application_Error: Required 'atrocious' and 'appalling' acts, ignoring psychological impacts
Review_Outcome: Case remitted for redetermination by a new Board panel

Application_Factor: Impact of past persecution on current risk
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed due to misapplication of law
Decision_Review_Issue: Correctness of legal interpretation under s. 108(4)
